channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024040680
item.description:
Report X-2024040680

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: WINDSOR
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found in trailer 837654 wet around 6am. Hazmat was place in a line tote. QA was notify about the wet hazmat pkg. and brought to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Upon inspection didn't have any inner packing. One of the bottles of industrial purple degreaser cap was loose and spilled. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat pkg was place in a line tote and brought to the hazmat cage for process.

item.description:
Report X-2024040702

  • City: CHINO

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed the Hazmat package smelled and that the package was wet and informed Management. Package was placed into a hazmat bag with absorbent and bag was placed into a hazmat tote. DescribePack: The top cap of one of the cans had a loose cap causing leak and leak soiled outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazmat bag with absorbent and bag was placed into a hazmat tote to prevent package from spilling out.

item.title: Report X-2024040655
item.description:
Report X-2024040655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging was wet on one side and was torn on the opposite side of it. White powdered granules was spilling out of the box. Inside were 25 different pool products all jammed up in one box. DescribePack: 3 bottles of 907 gram each of Leisure Time Brominating Granular had the top of the body crushed with the cap pushed inward. Indicative of a the bottle getting crushed far heavier than the 3 bottles can withstand together. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The powder granules were swept with broom and the whole package was placed inside a plastic lined container for a safer movement to HMPA for a better inspection.

item.title: Report X-2024040701

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment external packaging was wet and the shipment was removed from the discovery site and put into a plastic lined container DescribePack: The cap had been completely separated from the bottle body. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using absorbent material, the rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND GIVING OFF A DISTINCT ODOR. PACKAGE DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. DescribePack: NO MARKINGS INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. INNER PLASTIC JERRICAN MARKED AS FULLY REGULATED CLASS 5.1 CHEMICAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LEAKAGE CAME FROM VENTED CAP. SPILL MINOR, ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024040405
item.description:
Report X-2024040405

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be wet on the sides and emitting a strong vinegar scent and was removed from the sort stream. It was put into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: Moisture was evident around where the caps connected to the bottle bodies indicative a seal not extant . DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material while the rest of the shipmen was put into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery location.

item.title: Report X-2024040404
item.description:
Report X-2024040404

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment was returned from another station. On the way to its destination to the shipper, it was discovered that the outer packaging was discolored , wet and a palpable chemical odor came from the box. . The package was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: Both of the inner cans were dented , and the one that spilled the most liquid had its cap completely separated from the body. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material, the rest of the shipment was put into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040374
item.description:
Report X-2024040374

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Improper packing, bottles were packed as a one bulk with no protection. Caps became loose that caused an internal leak. DescribePack: Oversize package without thickness and no internal partitions to hold the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Usage of absorbent, plastic bag and placed into a proper hazmat container.

item.title: Report E-2024040285
item.description:
Report E-2024040285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-cups of GreenClean PRO were released from one (1) 50-pound plastic bag due to another pallet colliding with the bag, causing it to tear and spill out onto the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will place the contents into a 10-gallon metal drum. The terminal stated they will transfer the contents over to a 10-gallon poly drum and they will place plastic lining inside the metal drum that previously held the spill.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Responded to container UMXU 246369 in the City of Industry Yard, the container was found with a defected tote. The tote containing Ferric Chloride had a cut in the top of the tote causing five gallons of ferric chloride to release. The tote was transferred into a new tote and all impacted areas where neutralized.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the outer container while being unloaded. Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote. Upon inspection we discovered the bottle top was loose causing it to leak approx. 1ltr. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The bottle had a loose cap causing to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040221
item.description:
Report X-2024040221

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. WHEN MOVING THE PACKAGE FOR PROPER TRANSPORTATION TO VAN LINE, THE LEAKAGE WAS NOTED. THE AREA WAS CLEARED, PPE ALONG WITH NEUTRALIZER WAS RETRIEVED. NEUTRALIZER WAS APPLIED TO THE SPILL. BAY DOORS WERE OPENED TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL AIR FLOW. DescribePack: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE ITEM/SPILL, IT WAS NOT CLEAR AS TO THE EXACT INNER PACKAGE FAILURE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: RED TOTES PRE-LINED WITH HAZMAT BAGS WERE USED TO PLACE IMPACTED BOXES INTO, WHICH STEMMED THE LEAKAGE AND REDUCED ADDITIONAL VAPOR DISPERSION. IN ADDITION, CHEMICAL NEUTRALIZER WAS APPLIED TO THE SPILL.

item.title: Report E-2024040187
item.description:
Report E-2024040187

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 2, 2024, at 1424 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Los Angeles, California regarding regulatory reporting for the release of approximately 25 gallons of JP-8 (MIL-T-83133) FUEL, AVIATION, TURBINE ENGINE (UN1863, 3, III) from (1) 55-metal drum. The drum was found turned on its side and leaking upon arrival at the terminal, likely due to not being strapped in and secured properly. Terminal personnel conducted all clean up activities, and placed the leaking drum into an 85 gallon overpack.

  • City: ANAHEIM

  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE PRELOAD AT SPACE 118, USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE SLIDE, THE PACKAGE WAS SORTED TO THE PRELOAD BY EMPLOYEE ON THE SORT AISLE, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE AND OPENED THE PACKAGE UP, THERE WERE 4 -1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF ZEP CONCENTRATED CALCIUM,LIME RUST STAIN REMOVER, ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP , PROCESSED THE PACKAGE THROUGH THE DMP

  • Description: Shipment discovered leaking during offload of courier's vehicle. Leak was caused by a small puncture on the bottom of the plastic jerrican. The leak did not escape the truck and did not leak on the roadway. The plastic jerrican was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper. Product information: Permaclean, PC-97, CR4B0561A1
